title-group.article-title: COMPUTATION OF THE EUCLIDEAN MINIMUM OF ALGEBRAIC NUMBER FIELDS

abstract.p: We present an algorithm to compute the Euclidean minimum of an algebraic number field, which is a generalization of the algorithm restricted to the totally real case described by Cerri in 2007. With a practical implementation, we obtain unknown values of the Euclidean minima of algebraic number fields of degree up to 8 in any signature, especially for cyclotomic fields, and many new examples of norm-Euclidean or non-norm-Euclidean algebraic number fields. Then, we show how to apply the algorithm to study extensions of norm-Euclideanity.
